TopicTitle: Video Wednesdays: Two brothers. One Kerbal.

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/87dda5f22121633ebc5ff4dc817129a6/tumblr_inline_n5y8eb66MR1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/Gujlcp6Nbb4" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p>Scott Manley recently sat his brother down in front of a computer to teach him how to play Kerbal Space Program. We all know how good his skill and tutorials are, but does the unbelievable talent in rocketry run in the family? Watch to find out.</p>

Apparently "Gravity" is 91 minutes.

Uh, relevance?

As evidenced by the upside down biplane in the thumbnail, I'm skeptical that mad KSP skills are a genetic trait (and neither is attention span, which I why I can't get my sister to play it).

I'm disappointed when I see a Scott Manley/EnterElysium/Nassault/other-popular-YouTube-channel-video featured. Most people have already seen those videos. Why not show some video from a smaller channel with less views? Like this video. When it came out, I thought it would be featured, but it never was.

When it came out, I thought it would be featured, but it never was.

It's all right, I'm not sure it's 'featured' quality though. I struggled to watch it a bit as the transition between sections/frames was too quick for me to really see what was going on. Maybe some more lingering shots would be nice.

Also, it's 1h 17m less video than the Scott Manley one. Value for money?

It's all right, I'm not sure it's 'featured' quality though. I struggled to watch it a bit as the transition between sections/frames was too quick for me to really see what was going on. Maybe some more lingering shots would be nice.

Also, it's 1h 17m less video than the Scott Manley one. Value for money?

Hmm, I'm not sure I get your point. This video was a cinematic, and the guy who made it put a lot of work into it. It had two Kerbals walking at the same time (this required semi-advanced video editing), and some pretty awesome KerbCam shots. Again, it's just an example of many other not-as-popular videos that should deserve to get more views.

Scott Manley's video was a livestream, required minimal video editing, and has went into the video feeds of over 300,000 people. I actually watched it myself, and enjoyed it, but I think Video Wednesdays can be a time to showcase less-known videos. For instance, I really liked last Video Wednesdays. It showcased a video that many people (including myself) hadn't seen before, and it was nicely video-edited.

I wanna be featured! Or at least get some more views on the movie I'm making. I'm not quite feature quality in some but I do enjoy streaming and all other things I can do with WMV and OBS.

(This is the part where you peak at my signature)

Edited May 26, 2014 by Avera9eJoe

I'm disappointed when I see a Scott Manley/EnterElysium/Nassault/other-popular-YouTube-channel-video featured. Most people have already seen those videos. Why not show some video from a smaller channel with less views? Like this video. When it came out, I thought it would be featured, but it never was.

[sHNIP]

For the Fanworks Friday-before-last, I was hoping that my KSP cover would be featured. Instead, there was a Nassault video. Aren't videos supposed to be posted on Video Wednesdays?

(Given, I originally posted the song as a {somewhat poor} video itself but I had the raw audio file on the page before Friday.)

Here's the audio, in the spirit of shameless self-promotion. Everyone seemed to like it on the Fan Works page.

(I shouldn't complain, as I've made it to a Video Wednesday before. But still... )

I'm disappointed when I see a Scott Manley/EnterElysium/Nassault/other-popular-YouTube-channel-video featured. Most people have already seen those videos. Why not show some video from a smaller channel with less views? Like this video. When it came out, I thought it would be featured, but it never was.

That video is awesome. It needs to be featured! It's awesome! I said that already!

If you guys would like to see certain things featured or feel there are other creators that deserve more attention, please send links my way via PM. While we try to keep up with as much as we can, with so much new stuff being created by the community, it's very easy for work to slip by.

Hmm, I'm not sure I get your point. This video was a cinematic, and the guy who made it put a lot of work into it. It had two Kerbals walking at the same time (this required semi-advanced video editing), and some pretty awesome KerbCam shots. Again, it's just an example of many other not-as-popular videos that should deserve to get more views.

Oh no, I get that it's very technically difficult, and a lot of work has gone into it. I know I'd never be able to assemble something like this. I just found it a bit hard to watch on account of the 'fade-in-out bits' being a bit too quick for my eye to really clock anything in the frame is all.

In any case, I don't watch many KSP videos anyway, so I've probably seen about 4 Scott Manley videos to date. Just because he's popular, doesn't mean all of his videos have been obsessively watched by everyone, some of us only drift into these things through links.
